intro: Pilosella onegensis subsp. amauroderma, commonly known as the dark-leaved pilosella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its dark green, hairy foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
